Recommendation: The third party trackers on your site generate a low risk profile, meaning you do not necessarily need intensive recommendations other than good privacy hygiene. You should by regularly clearing your cookies via the settings provided by your browser. You should also be using private browing modes when possible. Click here to learn more.

The third party trackers on your site generate a medium risk profile, meaning you need to take some precautions to protect yourself. Specifically, you should be using a configurable extension or your browsers advanced settings to block cookies from certain sites. Chrome gives you this control. Visit this site to learn how to block cookies for a specific site on your computer, Android, iPhone, or iPad. We recommend you block the most pervasive cookies from sites shown on your report above. These steps should be taken along with proper internet hygiene such as clearing cookies regularly and using private browsing modes, which were the recommendations for the lowest risk level.

The third party trackers on your site generate a high risk profile, meaning you should take extra precaution to protect yourself. First, you should be regularly clearing your cookies and configuring your cookie settings to block third party cookies from the sites shown above. To learn how to do that, click here. You should also be using a more intensive tracker blocker. We recommend PrivacyBadger, which blocks pervasive third-parties that track you across 3 sites or more. If you are feeling like this is a lot of work, we recommend switching to Brave browser instead of using Chrome, which blocks many third-party trackers by default!
